item.title: Normed Vector Spaces and Inner Product Spaces
item.description: Normed Vector Space A normed vector space is a vector space $V$ paired with a function $\|\cdot\|: V \rightarrow \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$ called the norm function, that assigns “lengths” to vectors. For $\|\cdot\|$ to be a valid norm it must satisfy the following conditions: Non-negativity: $\|v\| \geq 0$ for all vectors $v$. Non-degeneracy: $\|v\| = 0$ iff $v = 0$. Absolute Homogeneity: $\|\alpha v\| = |\alpha|\cdot\|v\|$ for all vectors $v$ and scalars $\alpha$.
